pages.text: The Revolver, a more elegant weapon from a more civilized age, is an achievement of small mechanics. Small being relative here, since this weapon is chambered for 12-gauge.

Similar to the Mining Drill, the Revolver will allow for modification in the $(l:patchouli:overview/workbench_and_blueprints)Engineer's Workbench$(), as detailed on the last pages. $(br2)Note that firing the revolver is quite noisy, and will attract the attention of hostile mobs in the area! $(br2)There are different $(l:patchouli:tools/revolver_cartridges)types of ammunition$() the Revolver will accept. To load it, sneak + rightclick the weapon, then place cartridges into the slots.
A loaded $(#007500)Speedloader$() in your inventory will be used to refill the revolver after you've fired your last shot.
The $(#007500)Precision Scope$() allows you to zoom in with the revolver. Use Zoom with the Railgun to use the scope and scroll the mouse wheel to switch between magnification levels.
By attaching a $(#007500)bayonet$() to the revolver, you outfit it with close-quarter-combat capabilities, allowing for melee damage as powerful as an Iron Sword.
The $(#007500)Extended Magazine$() allows loading 6 more cartridges into the revolver. This magazine does not get refilled by a speedloader.

The $(#007500)Amplifying Electron Tubes$() apply an electric shock to fired projectiles. The target will be stunned for a fraction of a second and all powered equipment they may be using will suffer a slight discharge.
